infos.value: Reporting in, sir. Lord Sadali and his partyâ€”
Show me.
They are visible from here.
I see them. It is indeed Sadali.
Brother, let me see! Let me see!!
You don't need to see.
Why are you so mean to me!?
Now, how do we deal with this development?
This Sadali guy is our ally, isn't he?
For now. He mediated the alliance between Hourne and Fennes; it would never have been achieved otherwise.
What do you mean, "for now"?
You know that Muraga is attempting to betray us, don't you?
Uh-huh.
What if even that is part of Sadali's master plan...?
Which means...he would have control over not only Leonis and Wezette, but Hourne too.
Perhaps he's planning to attack Rundall after consolidating all that power.
That said, it's nothing more than conjecture at this point.
So, what's the plan?
There are two paths we could take.
We could continue swiftly down the path we are already on.
Wherein we fulfill our duty, thereby preventing Muraga from obtaining the ancient relics.
Or...we could keep a close watch on Sadali.
There's no mistaking that Muraga is Sadali's pawn.
Basically, keeping watch on Sadali might give us a clue about what Muraga's up to?
Exactly. What would you do, Salire?
I like the second option!
Why?
The fastest way to defeat an enemy is to go for the head, right? If it comes to that, of course.
Great minds think alike, I see.
You're saying I have a great mind, too!?
We're a perfect match, aren't we, Brother?
I wouldn't go that far.
Sir, if I may. It appears some monsters nearby have become aware of our presence.
Then we must exterminate them discreetly, so as not to draw attention from Sadali.
...And then?
We observe Sadali's movements from a distance.
And if worse comes to worst...I get to kill him, right?
If worse comes to worst, yes.
I sure hope the worst comes soon, then.
